data: PED NEPH AMB Renal Biopsy Once (Day of Treatment) - Prototype
MDU nurse to initiate Pre Procedure phase of this PowerPlan
If BP exceeds the 95% percentile based on the patients height, age and sex
Once morning bloodwork with TACrolimus level is completed, patient should take all medications with a few sips of water only
Except for Medication, Except for Sips of Water, No food after midnight on night before procedure. May drink clear fluids after midnight until 2 hours prior to procedure
Resource and Guidelines for Perioperative Management of Antithrombotic Therapy
0.3 mcg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj
0.3 mcg/kg, subcutaneous, once, drug form: inj
Blood, Routine, Unit Collect, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Routine, Unit Collect, Collection: T;N, once
If/when CBC, INR or PTT not done within past 6 weeks, then nurse to order CBC, INR and PTT STAT
Obtain urine pre-procedure and save aliquots for gross hematuria
Pre Renal Biopsy Request BC Renal Agency
Nurse to initiate Immediate Post Procedure phase of this PowerPlan. These orders continue onto MDU
Discontinue  Pre Procedure phase of the PED NEPH AMB Renal Biopsy Once (Day of Treatment) PowerPlan
q15min for 1 hour, q30min for 1 hour then q1h until discharge
If persistent pain, gross hematuria, abdominal pain, no urine output for 3 hours
Obtain aliquot from each void post-procedure for comparison
MDU Nurse to initiate Post Procedure - MDU phase of this PowerPlan
Post procedure/task/therapy, Discharge 6 hours post procedure (native kidney) if stable (lack of pain, stable BP and no visible hematuria)
Post procedure/task/therapy, Discharge 4 hours post procedure (transplanted kidney) if stable (lack of pain, stable BP and no visible hematuria)
Post procedure/task/therapy, Call nephrologist 4 hours post procedure to obtain discharge order
Prior to discharge when tolerating oral fluids well and passing urine with no gross hematuria
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
20 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 60 minute, drug form: bag
10 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 60 minute, drug form: bag
20 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 120 minute, drug form: bag
10 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 120 minute, drug form: bag
PED Peripheral IV and IV Fluids (Module)
15 mg/kg, PO, q6h interval, PRN pain-mild, drug form: oral liq
15 mg/kg, PO, q6h interval, PRN pain-mild, drug form: tab
0.3 mcg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj
0.3 mcg/kg, subcutaneous, once, drug form: inj
10 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj
Albumin transfusions can be ordered through PED TM AMB Albumin Infusion Once (Day of Treatment) PowerPlan
Routine, Special Instructions: Biopsy the most acccessible or appropriate kidney, Order for future visit, Scheduling Location: BC Children's - BCH Med Imaging
Routine, Special Instructions: Biopsy the most appropriate kidney, Order for future visit, Scheduling Location: BC Children's - BCH Med Imaging
Medical Imaging Department to initiate Procedural Test - Image Collect phase of this plan
Do not initiate this phase of the plan until specimen obtained
